question: A friend has agreed to look after your house and pet while you are on holiday. Write a letter to your friend. In your letter•	give contact details for when you are away•	give instructions about how to care for your pet•	describe other household dutiesWrite at least 150 words. You do NOT need to write any addresses.
text: I hope you are doing well and enjoyed the party last night. If you remember, I have planned my holidays next week and as per our last conversation you will stay at my home for that week.

I have already set up everything for you in advance and have made few notes, if there is any emergency. You can contact me on my new number 708-549-7888 and I have activated voicemail box on it, to get messages if there is no network.

As you already familiar with my dog – Jack and I believe he will not give you any trouble. I have booked an appointment with his doctor for Thursday, so please take him to the hospital for monthly vaccination. One more thing, his food bucket is already full, so don’t give any outside food to him.

Last but not least, I have placed an envelope for this month’s Utilities bills. So, please make sure you will drop this while going to office on Monday. I was expecting visit of plumber yesterday, but he reschedule his visit to Monday Evening, and he will contact you directly before coming.
At the end, I am very thankful for your help and I owe you big time for this. See you soon.

error_list.error_des: It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase as per our last conversation. Consider adding a comma.
It appears that you have an unnecessary comma before the dependent clause marker if. Consider removing the comma.
The word any doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
Your sentence appears to be missing a verb.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
The noun phrase visit seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
The preposition At may be incorrect. Consider changing it to a different preposition.
